summary: Why Jon Snow is like Erik (The Phantom)
body:
Why Jon Snow is like Erik (The Phantom)

1. In love with a woman younger than them

2. Have a thing for good singers

3. Are misunderstood and brooding

4. Are outcasts

tags: all fluff and no angst makes us a dull boy/gal/thing
title: Shadows 13
body:
(Rain Excerpt)

She raised her head then, all red-eyed,flushed, tear-streaked cheeks with a hint of snot escaping her nose. She might have looked a mess to anyone else, but to him…she was the most beautiful creature on earth, and he wouldn’t have her otherwise. With a hard kiss to her forehead, he reached for a napkin to wipe her face tenderly, patiently allowing her to blow her nose into it, before discarding the cloth to the side.

“And?” he asked with a small smile as he studied her bashful countenance. “Now you’ve heard my confession, it’s your turn to admit when you fell madly in love with me…hey!”

She had playfully tapped the side of his head, but quickly burrowed her heated face against his chest again, not trusting herself to speak. She settled for listening to his heartbeat and trying to synchronize it with hers.

I loved you long before I met you, she thought as she closed her eyes. You were always the prince in my dreams; the handsome knight who would rescue me from my world of darkness and solitude and show me how beautiful the world could truly be. You’ve always been there, Jon Snow. It just took a while for the gods to bring you to me.

Continue on AO3

(and a biiiiiiiig thanks to the wonderful @annagreengrass for the fabulous moodboard!)

summary: jon snow week ❄ ↳ day six: dreams   “Not my mother, Jon thought stubbornly. He knew nothing of his mother; Eddard Stark...
caption:
jon snow week ❄
↳ day six: dreams 

“Not my mother, Jon thought stubbornly. He knew nothing of his mother; Eddard Stark would not talk of her. Yet he dreamed of her at times, so often that he could almost see her face. In his dreams, she was beautiful, and highborn, and her eyes were kind.” - AGoT, Jon III.

title: Untitled...
body:
“I haven’t felt like that since…” her voice drifted off as she twirled her fingers through my chest hair, making the area tingle with sensation.

           I glanced down to see a troubled pale face, lilac eyes staring out towards the windows of the room. I knew what she meant. She didn’t have to say anything. Taking a hand from behind my head, a wrapped it around her, running my fingers through her soft silver hair.

           “Your Highness,” I whispered, looking back up to the wooden planks of the ceiling, trailing the grain. “You don’t have to say anything.”

           She propped up onto her elbow, looking towards me now, eyes fierce with control. “To everyone else, I am Queen Daenerys. To you… I am Dany.” She had a small smile on her lips, making me want to smile as well, but something was tugging at me.

           “You miss him?” I asked, running my thumb against her naked back, feeling her soft skin rise.

           Dany looked away, no longer my Queen. Now, she was a young girl, frowning deeply in thought. She sat up in bed, wrapping her arms around her legs, which was still covered by the blanket. I laid there, frozen. Scared that I have upset her.

           “I won’t lie to you,” she mummed, voice breaking. “I do miss him. He was, after all, my moon and my stars.” Dany turned towards me, a small tear sliding down her cheek. “Do you miss yours?”

           Ouch.

           I flinched at the thought of Ygritte. Her fire red hair, her spirit…her love. “Yes,” I choked out. “I do miss her, but if it wasn’t for her, I don’t think I would be here now.” I had my eyes closed because I didn’t want to see the disappointment in Dany’s eyes. It made my heart hurt just thinking about it.

           Dany didn’t say anything as she climbed out of the bed, but I watched her, wondering.

           “How did you know that I had someone?” I asked as I sat up, thoughtful of what she was doing.

           She chuckled under her breath, like she knew a secret that I didn’t.

           “You know nothing…”

           “When you asked about me missing my husband, I saw that you had lost a love as well,” Dany replied, grabbing a goblet and vase of wine. She turned towards me. I couldn’t help but look her up and down with awe. “Who was she? A lady? A whore?” She poured the wine into the cup, curiosity on her features.

           “She was no whore.” I frowned deeply, nearly growling the words out. “She was a Free Folk.”

           For a woman who doesn’t apologize to most people, I noticed my Queen wanted to, but I put a hand up to stop her. “No need, Milady,” I stated, wanting to say sorry as well. “I have heard my…brothers from the Night’s Watch call her worse, even while she was alive.”

           Dany nodded as she placed the drum down, walking back to the cot. She sipped the wine before handing the glass to me. I took a long sip, wishing it was Winterfell’s ale. This wine was too sweet for my tasting. She rested her head against my shoulder, soothing me.

           “I’m sorry,” she still whispered.

           Smiling, I rested my cheek against her blonde hair. “No need, Milady,” I whispered, wrapping my arm against her shoulders, pulling her close as I leaned back into the resting position. I held her close, kissing her hair. “It was a long time ago.”

summary: let me hold your hand - chininja - A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin [Archive of Our Own]
title: let me hold your hand - chininja - A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapters: 1/1
Fandom: A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin
Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
Relationships: Jon Snow/Sansa Stark, Arya Stark/Gendry Waters (mentioned)
Characters: Sansa Stark, Jon Snow, Arya Stark, OC - Character
Additional Tags: Alternate Universe - Modern Setting, tw: death of a child, Dealing with grief and loss, it’s mostly angsty, But it gets better I promise
Summary:

It’s a funny thing, time.

For such an abstract thing, it occupies nearly everyone’s mind. There are so many sayings attached to it too –

Time flies.

Time is precious.

Time is gold.

Time heals all wounds.

Jon and Sansa deal with the loss of a child and the all-consuming power of grief.

Summary:

It’s a funny thing, time.

For such an abstract thing, it occupies nearly everyone’s mind. There are so many sayings attached to it too –

Time flies.

Time is precious.

Time is gold.

Time heals all wounds.

Jon and Sansa deal with the loss of a child and the all-consuming power of grief.

trail.content_raw:
Chapters: 1/1
Fandom: A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin
Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
Relationships: Jon Snow/Sansa Stark, Arya Stark/Gendry Waters (mentioned)
Characters: Sansa Stark, Jon Snow, Arya Stark, OC - Character
Additional Tags: Alternate Universe - Modern Setting, tw: death of a child, Dealing with grief and loss, it’s mostly angsty, But it gets better I promise

tags: and now his watch is ended
summary: Following my post about Jon a couple days ago
body:
Following my post about Jon a couple days ago

Picture this: the living people win. Bran and/or Sam (I guess at least one of them will survive) tells everyone Jon is the rightful heir to Throne. But Jon is not the man who thinks people should rule just because of their birthright and their surname. So Westeros gets its first true democratic elections. And people vote for Jon, because he won the war.

So Jon stands up, gives them all the middle finger, and rides (maybe on Rhaegal) to the sunset in order to take his first proper nap in 8 seasons.
